metadata.title: CVE-2021-47260 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: NFS:Fix a potential NULL dereference in nfs_get_client() None of the callersare expecting NULL returns from nfs_get_client() so this code will lead toan Oops. It's better to return an error pointer. I expect that this is deadcode so hopefully no one is affected.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47260` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1069-fips - 4.15.0-1069.78
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1069-fips - 4.15.0-1069.78
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1069-fips - 4.15.0-1069.78
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1069-fips - 4.15.0-1069.78
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2053-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2053.55
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2053-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2053.55
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2035-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2035.39
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2035-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2035.39
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2018-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2018.20
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2018-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2018.20
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1069.78').
linux-aws-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2053.55').
linux-azure-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2035.39').
linux-gcp-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2018.20').
